column2: The Most Notorious Corsair Lord of the Black Ark Corsairs

Black Ark Corsairs are notorious reavers, having spent their entire lives pillaging distant lands. They are the lionised darlings of Naggarothi society, embodying as they do the drive to earn riches and glory.
The Most Notorious Pirate Lord of the seven seas

These are your scurvy seadogs. High sea reavers. Freebooters. Hard-bitten, windswept and weather-tanned. Just the right kind of people to beat seven kinds of tar out of prissy pants Imperials, weasely goblins, hoity-toity Tilean types and, well, other pirates that look at them funny.
Most Renowned Entrepenour and Explorer within the League
The League is organisation filled with map makers, traders and adventurers in pursuance of fame and fortune in exploring the unknown beyond the seas of old world.

Governing the Lands around [colonial_territory_capital.GetFullBaseName] have grown burdensome for our government to handle from over seas so we've begun the selection process for new governor of the area.

Our new governor for the lands around [colonial_territory_capital.GetFullBaseName] will need material and men to construct some kind of settlement to guard it from possible threats, so what shall we invest in to aid in their endevours?
The seneschal will make fine Governor
Meager funding to Establish an Town should be enough

column3: Ample funding to Establish an Town should be enough

column2: Meager Funding should do the trick for new fort
Ample Funding for an Fortress for new settlement

Your men overwhelm the defenses of [From.GetName] in fast lighting attack, as the walls crumble and fall. They are intent on plundering and enslaving the populace, but won't go ahead unless you, their [Root.GetTitle], give them permission to do so.
Bring back the spoils to me and we will divide them between us!

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]!

Our maps are in dire need of an update, would it be too much bother for you to take your ships and map the coastal sea of [exploration_target.GetName], If you seek to impress [Root.Society.GetName], [Root.GetMarchSail] [exploration_target.GetName]!

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]!

It is time for you to esbalish an colony of your own, we got couple viable targets for you or shall you acquire charter on your own?

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
Members of [Root.Society.GetName] frequently set out to map the coastlines of the world to update their maps and to seek out potential riches and adventures.
To complete this mission, you need to scout the coastal sea province of §Y[FromFrom.GetName]§!.
The members of [Root.Society.GetName] are not above occasional tomb raiding and temple looting for tales to tell their fellow guild members..
To complete this mission, Use the  §YExploration Casus Belli§! to loot the province of it's hidden riches.
The members of [Root.Society.GetName] are not above occasional tomb raiding and temple looting for tales to tell their fellow guild members..
To complete this mission, Use the  §YExploration Casus Belli§! to loot the province of it's hidden riches.
It's about time i set out to the seven seas to make an proper name for myself as an infamous Pirate
It's about time i set out to the seven seas to make an proper name for myself as an infamous Corsair
Itz time to deal with dese squealin panzee sea gits, show 'ow proppa boss getz best lootz.
Aye so it shall be done

Sigh... Greetings [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!\nIt's delighted to know that you have taken interest into exploration of the unknown. But if you can't afford our entrance fee am afraid we can't let you into our guild.\nSigned, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

Greetings [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
We are delighted to learn that you have taken interest into exploration of the unknown. The new discoveries and adventures await you.

Looking towards your discoveries and tales from across the land.
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Sure, i'll pay the entry fee
On second thought, i didn't actually want to join...
It's about time i've finally scouted the coast of [Root.Location.GetName], the fellow explorers of [Root.Society.GetName] shall be grateful.
